column1: DETROIT ( AP ) -- It 's been a long time since Nate Robertson last won a game . 	 The Tigers starter earned his first victory in more than six weeks
column2: allowing five hits pitching into the eighth inning to lift Detroit past the Oakland Athletics
column3: 6 - 1 on Sunday . 	 Curtis Granderson homered and Magglio Ordonez drove in two runs for Detroit
column4: which took two of three from the A 's . Oakland lost for the 12th time in 13 games . 	 Robertson ( 7 - 8) allowed a walk and one run
column5: striking out five in 7 2/3 innings to win for the first time since June 21 . Fernando Rodney finished for his third save in seven chances . 	 " There 's plenty of games that I pitched well
column6: " Robertson said . " I just tried to go out and pitch well again . That 's it . " 	 The Athletics threatened in the fourth
column7: loading the bases with two out . But Detroit second baseman Placido Polanco made a leaping snare of Kurt Suzuki 's knuckling liner to end the inning . 	 " There was a little english on that ball
column9: I did n't get it as much inside as I wanted it and he inside - outed it . ... He stayed with it and made a good catch . " 	 That began a string of 11 consecutive retired batters for Robertson
column10: ending with Jack Hannahan 's double with one out in the eighth . 	 " Nate was really good . His slider was much better
column11: " said Tigers manager Jim Leyland . " His fastball had a lot of late life to it . " 	 Mark Ellis followed with a single to break up Robertson 's shutout
column12: but Rodney came on and got Frank Thomas to ground out
column13: ending the inning . 	 Erratic Oakland starter Greg Smith ( 5 - 11 ) allowed only one run and three hits in 4 2/3 innings
column14: but walked an unsightly seven batters . 	 " My whole body was out of sync . It seemed that my arm was dragging on every pitch
column15: " Smith said . " It was about the third inning that I was able to make adjustment and feel comfortable . " 	 A 's pitchers walked a total of 10 batters . 	 " It was just a matter of too many walks
column16: " said Oakland manager Bob Geren . " We worked hard to win this series
column17: which would have been our first in a while
column18: but we just could n't do it . " 	 Granderson gave the Tigers a 1 - 0 lead in the fifth when he led off with his 15th homer
column19: lining an 0 - 1 pitch from Smith into the right - field stands . 	 " Ball down the middle of the plate
column20: was able to get it to go out of the ballpark
column21: " Granderson said . 	 Detroit made it 4 - 0 in the sixth
column22: beginning with Polanco 's bases - loaded single . Ordonez added a two - out
column23: bases - loaded single to drive in two more
column24: all the runs coming off struggling A 's closer Huston Street . 	 The Tigers added two in the eighth on Ryan Raburn 's RBI double and a throwing error by pitcher Jerry Blevins on the same play
column25: which allowed Raburn to score . 	 Game notes 	 Detroit LF Marcus Thames was scratched from the starting lineup because of a sore right shoulder . He was listed as day - to - day . ... Tigers ' 3B Carlos Guillen missed his second consecutive game with lower back spasms . Leyland said Guillen could play on Monday against Toronto . ... Oakland completed its first 1 - 9 road trip since 1981 . ... It was also the Athletics ' eighth - straight series loss . The last time that happened was 1994 . ... Polanco was 1 - for-5 . He is now hitting .417 ( 53 - for-127 ) for his career against Oakland . ... Hannahan 's double in the eighth ended an 0 - for-28 hitless streak . 	 The Braves added depth at catcher by signing Manny Pina to a two - year
column26: $ 8 million contract . 	 Randy Arozarena celebrates with his family at home after learning he won the 2021 AL Rookie of the Year . 	 From MVP to Cy Young and more
column27: this is your one - stop shop as baseball 's 2021 hardware is handed out . 	 Randy Arozarena hit 20 home runs and stole 20 bases this season
column28: leading all rookies with a 4.1 WAR . 	 Take a look back at the best plays from NL Rookie of the Year Jonathan India 's 2021 campaign . 	 Julio Lugo

column1: TORONTO ( AP ) -- Being the American League leader in wins and ERA is n't likely to go to Cliff Lee 's head . 	 Lee worked eight shutout innings for his AL - leading 16th win and the Cleveland Indians completed a three - game sweep
column2: beating the Toronto Blue Jays 4 - 0 on Sunday . 	 " It 's just easier when you 're having success
column3: " Lee said of his superb season . " Things go easier
column4: you have more fun . Things flow better when you 're having success . I 'm going to continue to just ride it out . " 	 Even as he carves up the competition
column5: Lee makes sure not to get caught up thinking about a 20 - win season or winning the AL Cy Young Award . 	 " You hear it all the time
column6: you 've got to keep your mind in the moment
column7: " Lee said . " It 's easier said than done
column8: but it 's something you 've got to be conscious of . If you feel yourself thinking about the past
column9: or trying to think about the eighth inning in the fourth inning
column10: you 're in trouble already . " 	 Lee ( 16 - 2 ) lowered his ERA to 2.45
column11: moving him ahead of Oakland 's Justin Duchscherer ( 2.51 ) for the major league lead . He won his fifth straight decision and has not lost since a 4 - 3 defeat at Minnesota on July 6 . He gave up eight hits -- seven of them singles -- with no walks . He struck out one . 	 " He was in control throughout
column12: " manager Eric Wedge said . " Did a good job moving his fastball around
column13: made some adjustments as the game wore on . Overall
column14: another real good day for Cliff . " 	 The left - hander is responsible for 16 of his teams 52 wins ( 31 percent )
column15: the highest percentage of any major league pitcher . 	 " He always makes me look like I know what I 'm doing
column16: " catcher Kelly Shoppach said . " I can call any pitch and he can execute it . " 	 Lee threw 104 pitches
column18: and had only one three - ball count . 	 " He 's a fun pitcher to play behind
column19: " outfielder Grady Sizemore said . " He attacks the hitters
column20: he goes out there and works the plate . He 's been doing it all year . It 's fun to watch . I hope he can continue this stretch and finish strong . " 	 The victory was Lee 's first in seven starts against Toronto
column21: the only AL opponent he had never beaten . 	 Lee pitched nine shutout innings against Toronto on May 12
column22: but the Blue Jays won 3 - 0 in the 10th against reliever Rafael Betancourt . 	 Rafael Perez wrapped this one up in the ninth to help Cleveland win for the 15th time in 25 games . 	 Shin - Soo Choo went 3 - for-4 with three doubles for the Indians
column23: who finished 6 - 1 in the season series against Toronto
column24: outscoring the Blue Jays 34 - 8 . 	 Toronto 's Vernon Wells returned after missing 26 games with a strained hamstring and started as the designated hitter
column25: but finished 0 - for-4 . 	 " Good to be back
column27: " Wells said . " Felt good some at - bats
column28: a little tardy on other ones . " 	 Scott Rolen ( left shoulder ) was scratched from the starting lineup and placed on the 15 - day disabled list after the game . Rolen revealed July 30 that his surgically repaired shoulder was causing him pain
column29: and has missed five of 11 games since . 	 Outfielder Kevin Mench
column30: originally optioned to Triple - A when Wells was activated
column31: will take Rolen 's place on the roster . 	 The Indians jumped on Blue Jays right - hander Scott Richmond ( 0 - 2 ) with a two - run first . Sizemore singled and came around to score when Adam Lind mishandled David Dellucci 's double to left . One out later
column32: Dellucci scored on Jhonny Peralta 's RBI single . 	 Toronto 's bullpen stirred and pitching coach Brad Arnsberg visited the mound after Choo doubled Peralta to third
column33: but Richmond got Ryan Garko and Franklin Gutierrez on grounders . 	 Cleveland made it 3 - 0 in the third when Choo hit a two - out double and scored on Garko 's single . 	 Making his third major league start
column34: Richmond gave up three runs and nine hits in five innings . He walked none
column35: hit two batters and struck out five . 	 The Indians added one more in the eighth against reliever John Parrish . Sizemore 's two - out single scored Garko from second
column36: but Alex Rios threw out Gutierrez at home plate as he tried to score from first . The assist was Rios ' major league - leading 13th of the season . 	 Game notes 	  Shoppach broke his bat over his thigh after striking out to strand runners at first and third in the fourth . Shoppach fanned again in the ninth and has struck out eight times in 12 at - bats . ... Toronto has lost the season series to Cleveland five years in a row . ... Three of Toronto 's eight shutout losses this year have come against the Indians . 	 In a free - agent field filled with future Hall of Famers
column37: Detroit added one of the most undervalued pitchers available this winter . 	 Joon Lee breaks down how Eduardo Rodriguez signing with Detroit affects the Tigers and Red Sox . 	 Check out some of the most electric moments from Vladimir Guerrero Jr. 's career . 	 Former Boston Red Sox left - hander Eduardo Rodriguez and the Detroit Tigers are in agreement on a five - year deal worth $ 77 million
column38: sources confirmed to ESPN . 	 From who we think deserves MVP and Cy Young to if the voters got it right
column39: this is your one - stop shop as baseball 's 2021 hardware is handed out . 	 Even Shohei Ohtani
column40: arguably the best player in the major leagues
column42: particularly when his team is n't winning .

column2: Josh Johnson glares down at home plate
column3: an imposing figure with an intimidating repertoire of pitches . 	 " You barely know he 's in the clubhouse
column5: " but when he takes the mound he has presence . " 	 And how . 	 The big right - hander stifled the New York Mets for a season - high seven innings Sunday
column6: leading the Florida Marlins to an 8 - 2 win and helping them avoid a three - game sweep by their NL East rivals . 	 A month into his return from reconstructive elbow surgery
column7: 30 pounds lighter and with a refined changeup to complement a dastardly slider and zipppy fastball
column8: Johnson has given Florida the kind of pitcher other teams paid dearly for in midseason trades . 	 " It 's like almost getting a big trade
column9: " Marlins manager Fredi Gonzalez said . " To get him
column11: was like Milwaukee getting [ CC ] Sabathia . " 	 The stats back Fredi Gonzalez up . The Marlins improved to 6 - 0 in Johnson 's starts this season
column12: including three wins against the rival Phillies and Mets . Sabathia is 6 - 0 for the Brewers . 	 Dan Uggla had two doubles and three RBIs
column13: Luis Gonzalez and Mike Jacobs each homered and Florida finished a 3 - 3 road trip with a breakout offensive effort that quashed the Mets ' hope of making a statement in the division . 	 Still
column14: the Mets returned to Shea Stadium after a 1 - 5 trip and began a stretch where they will play 23 straight days by taking two of three from Florida and jumping into second place in the East
column15: a half - game ahead of the Marlins . They entered Sunday one back of the Phillies . 	 Johnson ( 3 - 0 )
column16: who had Tommy John surgery in August 2007 after going 12 - 7 in his rookie campaign of ' 06
column17: gave up two runs and five hits to follow up six shutout innings in Philadelphia on Tuesday . He lowered his ERA from 4.18 to 3.19 with his last two starts . 	 " I felt real good today
column18: " Johnson said . " I absolutely attacked the zone . " 	 Endy Chavez 's leadoff triple in the third was the one hard - hit ball off Johnson . Chavez scored on Jose Reyes ' groundout . 	 Johnson struck out five in beating the Mets and Pelfrey for the second time -- July 30 was the first . 	 " Tremendous pitcher
column19: " Mets manager Jerry Manuel said . " He 's one of those guys you do n't want to see because he 's got a tremendous angle on his fastball and a good assortment of pitches . I was kind of hoping we 'd get a little rain
column22: but it did n't work out that way . " 	 The Mets had won nine of Pelfrey 's last 10 starts coming in
column23: but he gave up six runs in 4 2/3 innings in this one . The Marlins have scored at least five runs in each of his three starts against them this season . 	 After a swift first
column24: Jacobs and Uggla hit consecutive doubles leading off the second inning . Jeremy Hermida added a sacrifice fly for a 2 - 0 lead . 	 The Marlins added a run in the fourth on three straight two - out singles by Cody Ross
column26: who had the run - scoring hit . 	 Pelfrey ( 10 - 8) lost control in the fifth
column27: walking two ahead of Uggla 's two - run double and then hitting Ross in the back with a pitch . He walked Hermida
column28: then kept his back turned to his manager and stared out to center field the entire wait for Eddie Kunz to arrive from the bullpen . 	 " I think I made some bad pitches
column29: " Pelfrey said . " I made some stupid pitches
column30: and when I did they made me pay for them . Uggla came up and swung at the first pitch . It was supposed to be down and away and it was up . " 	 Kunz
column31: making his third big league appearance
column32: threw a wild pitch to score a run and make it 6 - 1 . 	 Gonzalez hit his sixth home run and Jacobs added his 25th off Carlos Muniz in the sixth
column33: and David Wright hit an RBI single in the bottom half for New York . Johnson eliminated any chance for a Mets rally by getting Carlos Delgado to ground into a double play . 	 " He 's been the stopper for us ever since he 's been back
column34: " Luis Gonzalez said of Johnson . " He has n't disappointed us . " 	 Game notes 	  New York will play Pittsburgh on Monday afternoon
column35: a makeup of a game that was rained out on April 28 . ... Mets closer Billy Wagner is on track throw a couple of innings at Class A Brooklyn next weekend as he rehabs from a strained left forearm . He 's scheduled to return from the DL on Aug. 18 . ... Marlins LHP Andrew Miller ( patella tendinitis in right knee ) pitched 3 2 - 3 innings in a rehab start for Class - A Jupiter on Saturday . He gave up five hits and a run . He is scheduled to throw 75 - 80 pitches for Jupiter on Thursday . ... Florida manager Fredi Gonzalez is confident that LHP Scott Olsen will make his next start . Olsen rolled his ankle covering first in the fifth inning Saturday night . 	 The Braves added depth at catcher by signing Manny Pina to a two - year

column1: CINCINNATI ( AP ) -- The Houston Astros looked mighty fine a day after losing slugger Carlos Lee . 	 In their first game after the National League 's RBI leader suffered an injury that could keep him out for the rest of the regular season
column2: Houston set season highs with eight extra - base hits and 13 runs while rolling to their biggest win of the season
column3: 13 - 4 over the Cincinnati Reds on Sunday . 	 Michael Bourn homered and drove in a career - high four runs and Lance Berkman and Geoff Blum also went deep to help the Astros post their eighth victory in their last 10 games . 	 Their 13 runs
column4: the most scored by Houston since an 18 - 1 win at St. Louis last Sept. 20
column5: came fewer than 24 hours after Lee broke his left pinkie when he was hit by a pitch . He is expected to be sidelined for 6 - to-8 weeks . 	 " Carlos already had [ 100 ] RBIs by mid - August
column6: " Bourn said . " That 's hard to do . We 're just trying to pick up the slack . It was a good day
column7: all the way around . " 	 Said manager Cecil Cooper : " We said people have to step up . Today is a prime example that we 're capable of doing it . " 	 The sweep was the Astros ' first of a four - game series in Cincinnati since May 21 - 24
column8: 2004 . The Reds have dropped a season - high six straight and 14 of their last 16 . 	 " That was some week here -- a bad week
column9: " Reds manager Dusty Baker said . " Not just bad games
column10: but a bad week . " 	 Wandy Rodriguez ( 7 - 4 ) retired the first 14 batters he faced on the way to his fourth win in his last five starts . He lasted 6 2/3 innings
column11: allowing five hits and two runs with one walk and seven strikeouts . 	 Aaron Harang ( 3 - 12 )
column12: activated from the disabled list before the game after not pitching since July 8 because of stiffness in his right forearm
column13: set a career high by allowing eight earned runs in just four innings . Houston tagged him for nine hits and a walk . 	 " Physically
column15: " Harang said . " Everything I threw was right over the middle of the plate . Early on
column17: they were sitting on my slider . That 's definitely not the way I wanted to come back . " 	 For the fourth time in the series
column18: Houston scored in the first inning
column19: this time plating five runs on RBI doubles by Miguel Tejada and Blum

column1: BALTIMORE ( AP ) -- With Ian Kinsler and Josh Hamilton leading the way
column2: the Texas Rangers emphatically ended an uncharacteristic hitting drought . 	 Kinsler broke out of an extended slump with a career - high five hits
column4: and Hamilton also connected to lead the Rangers past the Baltimore Orioles
column5: 15 - 7 on Sunday . 	 Held to one run over their previous three games
column6: the Rangers matched their season high with 20 hits . Kinsler had more hits than in his last seven starts combined
column7: scored three runs and collected three RBIs . He was 18 - for-88 ( .205 ) since the All - Star break and had not homered since July 5 . 	 " He was very good . It 's nice to see him back
column8: " Rangers manager Ron Washington said . " Hopefully
column9: he got his second wind and he can do what he did in the first half . " 	 Hamilton hit his 28th homer
column10: a three - run drive that snapped a 3 - for-22 skid and increased his major league - leading RBI total to 111 . Marlon Byrd went 4 - for-6 with a homer and four RBIs
column11: one of six Texas starters with at least two hits . 	 Now that 's Texas Rangers baseball . 	 " Today
column13: " Washington said . " The past two days
column14: it certainly was n't . " 	 Aubrey Huff homered to extend his hitting streak to a career - best 18 games
column15: Brian Roberts went 4 - for-4 and Melvin Mora had a homer and four RBIs . Baltimore
column16: which outscored Texas 18 - 1 in the first two games of the series
column17: fell to 2 - 17 on Sundays . 	 After holding the Rangers in check Friday and Saturday
column18: the Orioles could n't do it any longer . 	 " They were ready to break it out
column19: " manager Dave Trembley said . " They score an awful lot of runs
column20: and if you make a mistake
column21: they do n't foul it off . They hit it . " 	 Texas used a six - run fifth inning to go up 12 - 6 . Travis Metcalf singled in the tiebreaking run against Randor Bierd ( 0 - 2 ) and Jason Ellison hit a two - run single before Kinsler
column22: Michael Young and Byrd added RBI singles off Lance Cormier . 	 Byrd hit a three - run homer off George Sherrill in the ninth to complete the onslaught . 	 " It was a great time for us to start swinging the bats
column24: well aware that Texas has a day off before beginning a three - game series against the Red Sox . " Hopefully
column25: we 're going to Boston swinging the bats well . " 	 Byrd said
column28: go to Boston and try to catch up . That will tell us where we are at
column29: at the end of that three - game span . " 	 Texas starter Matt Harrison ( 4 - 2 ) gave up six runs and 10 hits in five innings . 	 Chris Waters
column30: who allowed one hit over eight innings in his major league debut with Baltimore on Tuesday against Los Angeles
column32: seven hits and three walks in four innings . 	 " Waters was a different pitcher today . His location was up
column33: " Trembley said . 	 Said Waters : " Right out of the gate I was n't really consistent with my fastball location
column34: and in the big leagues you 'll notice
column36: that if you miss your spots bad things happen . " 	 Kinsler began the game by hitting a popup that shortstop Alex Cintron lost in the sun . The ball dropped for a tainted single -- equaling the number of hits Waters surrendered in his debut . Young then drew a walk before Hamilton hit a drive to center that traveled an estimated 420 feet . 	 The Rangers batted around
column37: using a run - scoring RBI single by Metcalf to go up 4 - 0 . 	 Mora hit a two - run shot in the bottom half
column38: and Orioles rookie Luis Montanez added an RBI single in the second . Baltimore took a 5 - 4 lead in the third when Huff homered after Mora walked . 	 Kinsler put Texas back in front with a two - run homer in the fourth
column39: but Baltimore pulled even in the bottom half when Roberts doubled and scored on a two - out single by Mora . 	 Mora
column40: who added an RBI double in the ninth
column41: went 7 - for-14 with eight RBIs in the series . His homer Sunday was the 150th of his career . 	 Game notes 	  The 20 hits were the most yielded by Baltimore this season . ... Milton Bradley
